word: If we can have wire such as is put in screen doors, we can use a goods box, which will hold more than even a safe. . . . The wire can let in the air and the food can be kept from the opossums. . . . More is to be done to keep the cooking room safe from prowling animals. . . . I see so much absence of tact and ingenuity.--Letter 152, 1895, pp. 1, 3, 4. (To "Dear Daughter May" [Mrs. W. C. White], Aug. 26, 1895.)
